items.sentence: Tom didn\'t tell me why he didn\'t want to do that.
Tom won\'t even know what you did until it\'s over.
Why would anyone want to steal any of these things?
Why would your opinion be more important than mine?
Tom certainly seems to enjoy swimming with his dog.
Tom chewed Mary out for staying out all night long.
Tom climbed the mountain with Mary, John and Alice.
Tom told Mary more than he\'d expected to tell her.
Do you know why Tom didn\'t go to Boston with Mary?
Every Canadian that I\'ve met has been very polite.
Going to college doesn\'t guarantee you a good job.
Tom took the key off of the hook it was hanging on.
We\'ll arrive about one hour before Tom gets there.
We\'ve got to get back to Boston as soon as we can.
We\'ve known each other for more than thirty years.
I just want to make enough money to feed my family.
I\'m not impressed with anything I\'ve seen so far.
I\'m very tired because I\'ve been working all day.
I\'ve looked everywhere, but I can\'t find my book.
I was a sophomore in college the year Tom was born.
Tom Jackson was born in Boston on October 20, 1995.
Tom fell asleep during the show at the planetarium.
Tom finally managed to do what he was trying to do.
There\'s something else I want to discuss with you.
Tom might be better at French than you think he is.
Tom never did regain his memory after the accident.
Tom opened the door and asked Mary if she was busy.
Tom asked Mary if she\'d go to John\'s art exhibit.
Tom didn\'t have to go there if he didn\'t want to.
Tom decided to give up trying to keep up with Mary.
I\'m getting pretty tired of driving every morning.
I\'m going to put everything back where it belongs.
I\'m looking forward to seeing you and your family.
Let\'s hope that we don\'t have to do that anymore.
Tom was the one who told me about Mary\'s accident.
I don\'t think that Tom was in Australia last week.
I don\'t think that Tom will sing with us tomorrow.
I don\'t think they expected us to arrive so early.
I don\'t think what you need has been invented yet.
I don\'t understand how you can always be so happy.
I can draw you a picture of that if you want me to.
I think it must\'ve been Tom who wrote this letter.
I\'d like Tom to spend some time with our children.
I\'m not the only one who thinks Mary is beautiful.
Tom hasn\'t been drinking, so he can drive us home.
We have about thirty bottles of wine in the cellar.
We have five days to go before the summer vacation.
We may as well stay here till the weather improves.
We spent too much for Christmas presents this year.
The concert wasn\'t as long as I expected it to be.
